content: On July 3, 1992, the Atlanta Braves celebrated a thrilling victory over the New York Mets in a game that showcased the team's pitching prowess. Tom Glavine took the mound and delivered a stellar performance, throwing a complete game and allowing only one run as the Braves triumphed 6-1. This win was part of a season that would see the Braves clinch the National League pennant, highlighting their dominance in the early '90s.
